archimate:Assessment.name: There are systems that doesn't support more than 12 character password length
archimate:Assessment.documentation: The vulnerability associated with systems that don't support more than 12-character password lengths lies in their limited password complexity. Shorter passwords are generally easier to crack using brute-force or dictionary attacks. This limitation restricts users from creating more complex, and therefore more secure, passwords. As a result, these systems are more susceptible to being compromised, increasing the risk of unauthorized access and potential data breaches. Longer passwords are a fundamental aspect of robust cybersecurity practices.
